stem: The care coordinator is preparing a discharge plan for a client who sustained a stroke. Based on the documentation in the Rehabilitation Goals & Deficits tab, match the client's current need to the most appropriate interdisciplinary professional.

tabs.title: Nurses' Notes
tabs.content:
08:00: Client (72y/o male) status-post right-sided ischemic stroke. Left-sided hemiparalysis noted. 
09:00: Client is anxious about being able to live alone. He states, 'I can't even hold my toothbrush or comb my hair anymore.' 
10:00: During a speech attempt, the client struggles to articulate words (dysarthria) and has difficulty swallowing thin fruit juices.

tabs.title: Rehabilitation Goals & Deficits
tabs.content:
Deficit AreaCurrent StatusGoal
Gross MotorInability to walk 10 feet; requires max assistanceAmbulation with rolling walker
Fine MotorDifficulty with buttons and self-groomingIndependence with ADLs (Dressing/Grooming)
CommunicationGarbled speech; expressive aphasiaEffective verbal/non-verbal communication
SwallowingFrequent coughing during intakeAspiration prevention

rows.text: Difficulty with fine motor skills (brushing hair, buttoning a shirt)
Difficulty with gross motor skills (walking and transferring to a chair)
Difficulty with communication and swallowing safety
Difficulty with financial planning and home placement support

rationale.correct: Occupational Therapy (OT) focuses on fine motor skills and Activities of Daily Living (ADLs) (r1). Physical Therapy (PT) focuses on gross motor skills and mobility (r2). Speech-Language Pathology (SLP) manages both communication and swallowing (r3). Social Work (SW) handles environmental resources and discharge logistics (r4).
clinicalPearls: OT = Upper body and fine motor ADLs.
PT = Lower body and gross motor mobility.

questionTrap.trap: Referring a patient with swallowing issues to PT because they have a core body weakness.
questionTrap.howToOvercome: Swallowing 'safety' is always a priority and always falls under SLP's scope.

mnemonic.title: Which T?
mnemonic.expansion: PT helps you get to the sink. OT helps you wash your face at the sink.
